text:
Hi everybody, I have a question about the API possibilities within HubSpot; I am trying to read a Street name from an external zip code api tool but is this even possible?

It's about the next endpoint
<https://api.postcode.nl/documentation/rest-json-endpoint>

So I have to set up an APP within HS that handles the authentication
and then be able to do a js reqeust on a form;

Is this possible or can you only send HS data? I've been searching for a while now but keep coming back here <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/overview>

can someone point me in the right direction?

Hello everybody.

I am trying to extract the prior day’s engagements in a nightly batch process. I’m using the v1 get recent engagements endpoint. What I would actually like is to get the engagements created during the prior day, and not the modified engagements - it seems that HubSpot updates records at random intervals which makes my extraction fail because the total number of records passes the 10,000 mark (it’s a small company, we may get 5% of that in a normal day).

There has to be a way to get this data without extracting all engagements and filtering out the ones I don’t want. I was wondering if any of you could share some insight. Thanks in advance!

Hey all! Has anyone been able to successfully use the CRM API to import data with an association that is based on a foreign key and not the Company Id?

I have a custom object, App Data, associated with Companies. The field app_id exists on both objects and is how I would associate the records. Below is what HubSpot support thought would work, but it does not. Instead it creates a new company record each time I run it.

Any insight is appreciated. I've been spinning my wheels for days on this one.

```"ignored": false,
"columnName": "app_id",
"idColumnType": null,
"foreignKeyType": "string",
"propertyName": "app_id",
"columnObjectTypeId":"0-2",
"associationIdentifierColumn": true```
<@U019XAD5SFK> Were you ever able to get this to work? I'm running into a similar issue now and can't seem to find a solution. Thanks!
Is there a way to create a CTA via the HubSpot API? --- asking for a friend :stuck_out_tongue:
and get CTA's --- not their data just their ID's or information like "TYPE" etc.
